column.name: description
column.value: The Hassan II Mosque, one of the world's largest mosques, is an architectural masterpiece overlooking the Atlantic Ocean, featuring a 210-meter minaret.

column.name: description
column.value: The Old Medina of Casablanca offers traditional charm with narrow streets, bustling markets, and Moroccan architecture

column.name: description
column.value: Also known as the New Medina, the Habous Quarter combines traditional Moroccan architecture with modern planning, offering markets and a peaceful atmosphere

column.name: description
column.value: This Catholic church boasts beautiful architecture with stained glass windows, symbolizing Casablanca's religious diversity.

column.name: description
column.value: Inspired by traditional architecture, the New Medina blends modern Moroccan style.

column.name: description
column.value: The central square pays homage to King Mohammed V, surrounded by significant government buildings and banks.

column.name: description
column.value: The historic courthouse, Mahkama of the Pacha, is renowned for its intricate architecture, reflecting Moroccan craftsmanship.

column.name: name
column.value: The Church of the Sacred Heart

column.name: description
column.value: This Catholic church features neo-Gothic architecture and serves as a place of worship and cultural heritage.
